titleStmt.title: The manner how the prisoners are to be brought into the city of London, this present Saturday being the 21th. day of Iune, 1645. And met by the Greene and Yellow Regiments at Islington. And in what manner they are to march through the city with their colours that were taken by Sir Thomas Fairfax, carried before them. As also, a list of the figures and mottoes of the said colours, and how afterwards they are to be disposed of.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.F. and J. Coe,

notesStmt.note: The prisoners were taken at Naseby.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
